resources.string: Are you sure want to exit?

The application was ready within two days, but I had a problem with the Room library version. Since I was unable to access the Object created through Room and I thought it was my fault in the code. This problem persisted for 3 days. Fortunately, after changing the version of the Room library from 2.4.2 to 2.4.3, the problem was resolved. I also can use Cortoutines instead of Rxjava if you want to. Also, I can change the code from Kotlin to Java if Kotlin is not used in your company. I noticed that there are no restrictions in the task, so I tried to use the fastest one. I look forward to your feedback
The goal of the test task is to implement a simple application which fetches and shows a few GeoGebra materials in a grid and can show its details in a separate view.
MVVM, Hilt with other Jetpack libraries, Navigation, RxJava, Retrofit, Glide, Material Design, Room
